text: [Applause]
he's getting quite used to the adulation
though he doesn't yet have a grip on
power but he says labour is a government
and waiting waiting is exactly what his
supporters were prepared to do queueing
up to hear his conference speech
helpfully you seem to have a copy with
him
[Applause]
there's little doubt that he's changed
his party but his task today was to
convince more skeptical voters but you
really can change the country we are
ready and the Tories are clearly not
they're certainly not strong and they're
definitely not stable
he said the loss of a conservative
majority had led to a series of new
turns and as he listed them his
supporters cheered each one and he come
for one more the abolition of tuition
fees labor was the party of unity
bringing generations and communities
together rather than pitting young and
old against each other which is what the
Tories did Labour's own divisions of the
EU were displayed this week but Jeremy
Corbyn attacked what he called the
Conservatives brexit bungling so I have
a simple message to the cabinet for
Britain's sake pull yourself together or
make way labour is the only party that
can bring together those who voted leave
and those who backed remain and unite
the country for a future beyond brexit
but as criticism of the Conservatives
became even harsher when he mentioned
the tragedy of Grenville turf the
disdain for the powerless and the poor
have made our society more brutal and
less caring now that degraded regime as
a tragic monument the chilling wreckage
of Grenville Tower and horrifying fire
in which dozens perished an entirely
avoidable human disaster he launched a
review of social housing and said
tenants won't be fully consulted when
their estates are to be redeveloped and
he pledged to make private renting more
affordable to rent controls exist in
many cities across the world and I want
our cities to have those powers too and
tenants to have those protections
it's always easy to get a cheer the
constant speech if you mentioned the
emergency services but Jeremy Corbyn
linked his praise to Labour's policy on
public sector pay everyone praises them
everyone praises them but it's labour
that values them and is prepared and is
prepared to give them the pay rise they
deserve and protect the services they
provide Jeremy Corbyn claims he is
moving the political mainstream to the
left but warned delegates at more work
was needed if the party was to put its
ideas into action I hope we've left our
own divisions behind but we must make
our unity practical we know we're
campaign ready we must be government
ready to a standing ovation was always
guaranteed
but as Jeremy Corbyn aspires to
government his policies will now have to
stand up to even greater scrutiny the
immortan BBC news
[Applause]
